stadium.name: The Buccaneer's Bowl
stadium.description: A flashy, pristine stadium built on a private beach exclusively for resort guests. The field is imported turf, and a massive, puppet kraken in the bay entertains the crowd at halftime.

stats.pregame_ritual: Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Sticking leeches to their legs to 'lighten their step'.
Bribing a local oracle with a meat pie for a vague prophecy.
Reviewing hand signals for secret plays.
Reading their own fortune in a scattering of knuckle bones.
Thanking their armor for the protection it's about to offer.
Painting their teeth with a mixture of charcoal and water.
Doing a series of loud, guttural breathing exercises.
Reciting their grocery list backward to clear their mind.
Clapping their hands a prime number of times.
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.

stadium.name: The Prismatic Pavilion
stadium.description: A massive, permanent, open-air fairground pavilion built on stilts over the Starlight Lagoon. The field is a chaotic mix of colorful stage-planks, constantly surrounded by the Prismatic Troupe's performers.

stats.pregame_ritual: Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Tracing an invisible, complex sigil over their heart.
Performing a series of aggressive, theatrical poses.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Staring at their reflection in a bucket of water until they feel 'ready'.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.
Staring intently at their gauntlets, as if for the first time.
Plucking a single hair from a teammate's beard for luck.
Trying to start a 'slow clap' with the audience before the game has begun.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.

preGame:
Step right up and feast your eyes on the most beautiful sight in all of Osterra! It's Tuesday Night Trollball, and we are coming to you live from the Buccaneer's Bowl at the Toast Island Resort! üèùÔ∏è I'm your host, Nok the Corrupter, and boy, do we have a do-or-die humdinger for you tonight! This is Game 2 of the Losers Bracket playoffs, and the Starlight Bazaar Bizarres are fighting for their very lives after dropping the first match to the home-town favorites, the Tortell Privateers! The sun is blinding, the tourists are distracted by their fancy umbrellas, and the air is thick with the sweet scent of impending trauma! ‚òÄÔ∏èüèà

Down on the pristine turf, the rituals are gettin' downright peculiar! I see Keisling Damalas for the Privateers painting his teeth with charcoal‚Äînow that's a man who wants his bite to be as dark as his soul! Meanwhile, Dib Tufts just downed a raw egg, shell and all! ü•ö That‚Äôs the kind of grit that makes a demon‚Äôs heart skip a beat! The Privateers are looking to sweep this series right here on the beach, and the resort security is already nervous about the bloodstains on the imported grass. If those 'heroes' like Elspeth Ortell think they can keep this match civilized with their ritual sangria, they've got another thing coming! üç∑

But don't count out the Bizarres just yet! Bush Heiner is already three laps deep around the perimeter, and Quintessa Austine is desperately trying to get a slow clap started with a crowd that‚Äôs more interested in their tan lines than the score! üëè The Bizarres are desperate, and a desperate player is a dangerous player! They‚Äôve got the luck of the lagoon on their side, and they‚Äôre ready to turn this resort into a graveyard of broken dreams! Will the Privateers finish the job, or will we see a Game 3? Grab your grog and tighten your helmet, because it‚Äôs time for Trollball! üíÄ‚ú®
postGame:
Holy mother of mayhem, what a spectacle of sporting slaughter! The Starlight Bazaar Bizarres have roared back from the brink of elimination to snatch a 4-2 victory right out of the Privateers' greedy hands! üèüÔ∏è We are going to a Game 3, folks, and I couldn't be happier if Lord Orzalon himself handed me a fresh soul to snack on! This wasn't just a game; it was a rhythmic dance of destruction on the sands of Toast Island! üèùÔ∏èüí•

The action started at a fever pitch when Bush Heiner snagged the troll head right in Center Field, but the Privateers weren't playing nice! Castorina Gies decided Pompei Hephzipa didn't need to be standing anymore, delivering an INJURY that set the tone for the evening! üöë But the Bizarres didn't blink! Quintessa Austine gave Gies a taste of his own medicine, sending him to the healer faster than you can say 'fey circus'! üé™

Lilithe Royce showed some of that Privateer's plunder spirit early on, sending a beautiful 2-point Shoot straight through the goal from Center Field! üéØ For a moment, it looked like the Privateers were going to cruise to a series sweep, and the resort guests were cheering like they actually understood the sport! Even that rogue Sawyer probably would've been impressed if he wasn't busy dodging the circus life! ü§°

But the Bizarres found their second wind! Milo Nelie, perhaps inspired by that invisible sigil he traced earlier, absolutely flattened Goldberg Tova! üëä It was a beautiful, bone-crunching tackle that left Tova staring at the blinding sun while the Bizarres started to find their rhythm. The crowd was a mix of gasps and cheers, mostly from tourists who thought the injuries were part of the resort's halftime puppet show! üé≠

Speaking of halftime, that massive puppet kraken in the bay was a real treat, though it lacked the genuine menace of a real sea beast! During the break, you could see the players hitting the open bar hard‚ÄîMelo Nelie was stumbling just a bit more than usual, and I‚Äôm pretty sure I saw one of the Privateers trying to tackle his own reflection in the surf! üç∫ The drinking was heavy, and the hits in the second half were even heavier!

Once the play resumed, the violence didn't skip a beat! Kidder Starkey for the Privateers decided Aggri Cookie looked too healthy and sent him packing with a vicious INJURY! ü©π But Melesa Zelten wasn't having it! He lined up a massive Shoot from the 2-point line and nailed it, tying this game up and making the Privateers' fans go silent! ü§´

The tension was so thick you could cut it with a bastard sword! Goldberg Tova came back from the healer only to seek immediate vengeance, tackling Quintessa Austine and sending him right back to the sidelines! ü§ï It was a revolving door of pain, and I haven't seen this many people in need of a healer since Sir Tanos tried to read a book! üìö‚öîÔ∏è

But the hero of the hour‚Äîand I use that word loosely because we all know I hate heroes‚Äîwas Aggri Cookie! Despite the earlier hit, he stepped up in Center Field and launched a 2-point Shoot that hit the basket with the authority of a demon's decree! üéØ That goal put the Bizarres up 4-2 and effectively silenced the Buccaneer's Bowl! The Privateers tried to mount a comeback, with Keisling Damalas and Lilithe Royce scrambling for possession, but the Bizarres' defense held like a cursed vault! üîê

As the final whistle blew, the Bizarres celebrated like they‚Äôd just won the Everwar itself! The series is tied 1-1, and we are headed to a winner-takes-all Game 3! The Privateers looked stunned, their plans of a quick vacation ruined by a group of circus performers and lagoon-dwellers! üé≠üè¥‚Äç‚ò†Ô∏è I bet even Cinnemon, that 'just a little guy,' could have seen this upset coming with his cursed literacy!

So, the Bizarres live to fight another day, and the Privateers have to figure out how they let a 2-0 series lead slip through their fingers like sand! I‚Äôll be here, waiting for the blood to dry so we can do it all over again! This is Nok the Corrupter, reminding you that in Trollball, the only thing that stays dead is your pride! Stay brutal, Osterra! üíÄ‚ú®
